Posts.Content: Have an amazing day, enjoy every minute you deserve it. Thanks for the inspiration
Posts.Title: Good News Story for a cold Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I have to thank everyone for the amazing support that I have received over the past month but again have to ask for advice and ideas. I am waiting for a SNB, which was cancelled last week and might be this week. I was hoping to have the mastectomy within the next couple of weeks but have been informed the plastic surgeon is going on leave therefore my surgery will be 21 st may. My surgeon has started me on letrozole and said don't worry the meds will stop any growth or spread.  I just want this disease removed, is it ok to wait? I can't see any alternative as there is no other surgeon available.
Posts.Title: Surgery delay

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn thanks so much for your reassuring words. I feel better for reading your response, think I just found it difficult to believe the Dr as I've had a few delays with treatment. I hope you are keeping well.
Posts.Title: Surgery delay

Posts.Content: Hi Kate I had a diep reconstruction and wore m and s big pants. That was 5 months ago and I can't get used of normal pants again! I promise it gets better but it does take time. It's still early days. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Underwear woes after diep flap

Posts.Content: Hi there, I had a similar dilemma to you and finally decided to have a diep reconstruction. Yes the recovery is longer but I am now really pleased with the out come.  My new boob has sensation  and is part of me, although is a bit of a Barbie boob until it settles down a bit more. I do have a lovely flat stomach but have a massive scar. Which ever decision you make has to be right for you, good luck. Xxx
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi jacqui I was in the shower with help in hospital on day 4. It has taken a while to get back to something like normal. It took me about 3 weeks to be able to stand straight, as the tummy wound was sore. I went out and about walking short distances after a couple of weeks but only for short amounts of time. I was not allowed to drive for 6 weeks.  I did have help from my family to do housework etc for a few weeks. I know I was very lucky. Let me know if you need more info. Good luck with your decision xx
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi Jacqui sorry I should have said I was wearing a normal non wired bra within a few days and am back wearing the same size as before surgery.  The pain relief i received was also great. I cant say there was no pain but it was definitely manageable. It is a big op but for me was worth it.
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi my diep tummy scar is hip to hip, it is quite high but if I wear big pants  (which you need to for many weeks for support) you cannot see it. Luckily vintage big knickers on bikinis are very in!  My new tummy button looks good, and although it takes a bit if getting used to, it does become the new you! I intend to show off my tummy later in the year and would have not thought about that pre operatively.....i am trying to make the most if the positives  Good all all xxx
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi Jacqui yes I am really pleased, I know I'm not perfect but I have a flat tummy and two breasts, both of which feel like me. I know it's a really personal decision but for me the diep was the best thing to do. I totally understand why this option would not be right for some women as the recovery is a lot longer and you do need ample tummy!
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi, as you will have seen in my previous posts I had a really successful diep reconstruction in may. Yes the recovery is long I would be lying if I said you feel well quickly, but it isn't as bad as you imagine. My results are excellent and am really pleased. My new boob is starting to look quite normal and I have sensation. It feels like me. My tummy scar is large but is fading and doesn't show under my knickers. Good luck with your treatment I am happy to answer any questions.
Posts.Title: Advice with reconstruction: implants verus DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi just to say that although things seems bad now they will get better. I too ended up with the Drs saying I may have uterine or ovarian cancer as well as breast cancer, after biopsies and also having my ovaries removed everything came back as normal.  Good luck with your treatment, post anytime as in my experience there will always be someone around with a friendly word.
Posts.Title: New girl on the block and scared to death

Posts.Content: Hi Eli I only had my reconstruction a week ago but am very flat too. According to my surgeon it will improve significantly but will take 6 months. She will then undertake nipple reconstruction and any further surgery required. She did say I should gently encourage my breast into my bra to improve the shape.  Good luck
Posts.Title: Mastectomy with DIEP flap

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, am feeling low today, as I was started on aromasin 2 weeks ago, bloods said i was post menopausal so onco said it's fine. Was doing well on them but yesterday started a period. Phoned hospital today have been told not to take anymore and I need to see onco after his return from leave in 10 days. It took 6 weeks post op to start this medication and now I am worried I have lots of extra hormones floating around which will stimulate the cancer to grow again. Don't know why but my worry seems to have gone into overdrive! My bcn is also not available.
Posts.Title: Aromasin stopped due to bleeding, feeling confused

Posts.Content: Hi Liz I recently had an angiogram of my abdomen as I am having a DIEP reconstruction on the 21 st may. The procedure is quick and painless although you have a strange feeling that you are weeing! I was fine to drive afterwards and went shopping in the afternoon!  Good luck  Clare
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: Hi Liz it will be 9 weeks since my diagnosis, so the waiting has been hard. You may also need a sentinel node biopsy to see if you need nodes removing under your arm. I had that done 2 weeks ago. It was more painful than anticipated. I have had my last consultation with the plastic surgeon today, it's very real now. How are you coping with the wait?
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: Sorry Liz I should have thought to ask are you having an immediate or delayed reconstruction
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: Hi I had a mastectomy with diep reconstruction done on 21st may and am really pleased with the results. I won't lie it is a big surgery but doable. I am now fitter than I have ever been and have a lovely flat tummy. The scarring is significant but you soon get used to it. The recovery was quite long bit am still happy I took this oprion.  Good luck with your treatment
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn thank you for your reply. my oncologist was very definite about the 3% risk as I did question him. He is classed as a lead on breast cancer in Birmingham, so I very much trust his information.  I'm trying just to forget the test and enjoy tbe lovely weather.  Hope you are well.
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Nik2017 Sorry to hear you might end up with a drain but perhaps it will help the healing process? Good luck with your results will be thinking of you.
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your replies they are really appreciated. I think I will ring after a couple of weeks. Fingers crossed it will come back with a low score.  Trying to forget it and enjoy tbe sunshine.
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Poor you, I bet having it drained is uncomfortable. I am now 4 weeks post mx with diep, and thank goodness as healing well but am rather lopsided. They have only just decided to send mine for testing so have a long wait. Good luck with your results
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Can anyone put my mind at rest, I have had surgery to remove a 20mm grade 1, her 2 neg, er positive bc. The oncologist has said no chemo as only a 1% increase in survival rate versis 3%risk of chemo. He has said he will now send off for onco dx test, and to go back in 6 weeks. I can't settle thinking will this show something different? Does it take that long to get the results? Sorry to ramble.
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Nic, that's so good news about you not needing chemo. Fingers crossed I will be in the same situation. Made me feel more positive about the results, hope mine comes back in 2 weeks like yours.
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Jude thank you so much for your really kind words. It sounds like you are brave and coping with chemo really well. I will phone my oncologist in a few weeks and fingers crossed he will have the results. The waiting is the hardest. Good luck with the rest of your treatment
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry 5 weeks is such a long time to wait, I'm hoping mine might not take that long. Good luck with your treatment and thanks for your support
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi islandgirl, I had a mamogram as I had a lump which turned out to be cancer, but it also showed 2 areas of calcification. I needed specialist vacuum biopsies of these areas but they came back as not cancerous or even pre cancerous.  So please try to stay positive, although I know this can be hard.
Posts.Title: Calcium in breast
